snippet: The expropriation would reassert state control over a pillar of Argentina’s economy but also increase diplomatic tensions with Spain and the European Union.
abstract: Argentina will seize a 51 percent majority stake in YPF, the nation's largest oil company; expropriation reasserts state control over an important pillar of country's economy, but announcement has already increased diplomatic tensions with Spain and the European Union; YPF is majority-owned by Spanish energy firm Repsol YPF.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro and Raphael Minder from Madrid. Charles Newbery and Emily Schmall contributed reporting from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: The expropriation would reassert state control over a pillar of Argentina’s economy but also increase diplomatic tensions with Spain and the European Union.

headline.seo: Argentine President to Seize Control of Oil Company
headline.main: Argentina to Seize Control of Oil Company
headline.print_headline: Argentina to Seize Control of Oil Company
